General Assembly Javascript.

After leaving HLN and spending some time working with a team of developers, I wanted to put some effort into becoming a better front end developer and enrolled in a 10 week, part time General Assembly course for JavaScript. Going into the course, I had some basic understanding of the language, but most of my usage came from prewritten plugins. We started off with the fundamentals of variables, loops, functions, and scope and built a simple slackbot app that would respond in chat if given a command. My bot was set up to to return the current day and time, with a 12 hour clock rather than 24, as well as return a hex color based on the color name provided. After the slackbot, we moved on to JSON, manipulating objects in the DOM, AJAX, making API calls and working with the data, and spent some time overviewing authentication, tokens with API keys, Oauth, prototypical inheritance, prototypes, and constructors. Our closing project was to create an app that utilized data from a third party API that would run on a Firebase database. I decided to use Flickr to build an image gallery by searching their image database and saving to my own. My final project.
